resources.string: This device doesn\'t support Camera2 API.

Agro-Aid: An Ag Citizen Science App
Chief Engineer AI Lead: Sai Tanya Kumbharageri
SCAD AI's AI For Good initiatives collaborations.


Welcome to the homepage of Agro-Aid, an app built as a foundation for vision-ai in crop disease, plant malnutrition and pest attack. Further, the app is also capable of audio tagging through AI.
 The homepage is provided with 7 options 
• Nutrient Deficiency: To identify any nutrient deficiency in plant. 
• Disease Attack: To identify any disease attack in plant. 
• Pest Attack: To identify any pest attack in plant 
• Audio Tagging: To classify a sound 
• Guide: To read information on current weather, tools and more. 
• About: To open this tutorial. 
• Contact: To get in touch with us. 

Exit the tutorial to continue with the application. 
Have a great day.

To plant a paddy crop, while farmers use land, indoor plantation can be done in a garden or a bucket. 1. Obtain rice seeds from any gardening or farmer’s supply store. You may also take help from the local agriculture field officer. 2. Choose the location with a long, warm growing season of 3 to 6 months (min 21° Celsius). 3. If using buckets, fill them with 6 inches of moist soil. 4. Soak the seeds in water for 12 to 30 hours, before sowing. 5. Plant the soaked seeds throughout the soil, during the fall or spring season, preferably in rows. 6. To prevent crowding, space out the rice seeds. -> Gap between seeds: Not more than 4 inches apart. -> Gap between rows: 9 to 12 inches apart. 7. Fill the soil with more than 2 inches of water. 8. Keeping the soil constantly wet, observe the water levels. 9. Wait until the plants are about 17 inches tall, when the rice grains mature. 10. Dry out any excess water and let the plants turn gold. 11. Cut the stalks and let the seeds dry. 12. Bake them for an hour, at the temperature of 180°F (82°C). 13. In the end, separate the kernels from the hulls.
